verbatim_example: I'll be a year clean. I never imagined I'd get here... this time it's finally taken hold.

I quit everything about a year and a half ago with the help of a detox place. I relapsed by starting to use Kratom and then ventured into RC benzos as a way to get off Kratom, but of course that spiraled into abusing both and graduating to harder opiates as well as filling my adderall script.

I quit opiates/benzos/adderall 12 days ago, now I am trying to stabilize on Kratom. For the past 4-6 weeks I was trying to go about 4-5 days before using again, but wasn't really lowering my doseages.
The last time I took DHC or Xanax was the Sunday of Labor Day. ... It's been about 48 hours since last Kratom dose, I'm on day 20 I believe from last DHC/Xanax dose.
Many know I have been dealing with a tough addiction and recent withdrawal. I was on a large benzo/opiate habit and got off both 3 weeks to the day.
I've been 4 months sober, I'm doing better now with my cravings... This is the first time in my life I feel like I'm making real connections with people.
I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love. Helping other addicts who are suffering.
I am in the thick of wd. (withdrawal) - This sentence is in the present tense, indicating that the user is currently experiencing withdrawal symptoms.
The oxy and benzos ruled my every waking moment. ... The wrestless legs still won't quit.
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad.
I am happy to be here, sober .
She tells me she still uses.
Every year, Ive celebrated by getting as high as possible. Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something.
Six months and some change ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel.
I used to run one in r/opiates
I was in a hospital bed, could barely walk and breathe, was doing the “undercover ninja” every night to try and get comfortable to sleep, and had no direction or positive things in my life.
a year ago I was in a hospital bed with a Staff Infection and Pneumonia; I was making plans to go pick up the second I got out...
I’m officially one year clean from opiates.
It's day 3 off of a 8 day relapse. Came clean to everyone I know (all very supportive) Been a closet oxy user for years... had some good clean time before lapsing the last 8 days prior to Saturday.
One week down, working on day 8.
Eight days down, moving into day 9. ... Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass.

I'm wrapping up day 11 in a few hours and figured I'd spew some shit out about progress that might help someone. ... Now the work comes with a reward instead of a temporary numbing of everything around me.
I was talking to someone last night about how most of us do enough research to have PhDs in this shit.
about to head to the gym in hopes of pumping some natural feel good into my body.
Today I feel... decent? It feels like my body is trying to act normal and my brain is just a few steps behind.
I can say that I have never had a craving in the 17 days up until that point.
Closing in on 3 weeks, Yesterday went pretty well other than a few cases of the clammy sweats... Feeling better every day...
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats. Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves.
This was the day of the month I would get my script refilled and normally start the process of one GREAT week followed by the cycle of withdrawal etc etc.
Yesterday sucked but it's all good. Another day down
I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would.
I've now gone five days without
I have been off heroin for six days now, but last night and this morning i had an incredibly bad toothache. I mean I was literally writing in my bed in pain.
I've gone further than I thought I could. I've been browsing here it really helps.
I haven't thought that in a long time even when I made it to three days before.
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way.
Day 4 in tha books! Can't believe it! (emphasis on 'Day 4' indicates past tense, and the state label is 'withdrawal')
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least.
It's been a month and a half. (past tense), ...Stick with it. I was hopeless. If I can do it, you can. (past tense)
Anyways, at anytime I keep at least 40 pounds of poppyseeds incase the site I order from gets shut down, or something gets lost in the mail, by doing this, I haven't WD'd in close to 2 years,
I'm going to get totally straight hamstered!

I've cut myself off my main supply by requesting my mother stop refilling her meds (she doesn't actually take them - I simply con her out of them) this time around. Last time I told my friend that I was going to rehab, and she won't sell me her pills anymore.
I'm actually looking forward to it, rather than mocking the whole process. The days where I feel out of control and anxious are farther and farther apart.
I've got 4 months clean and sober - the idea of being in pain just riles me up. I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.
I've dedicated myself to being a "strong, independent woman" who can overcome anything once I put my mind to it. I kicked a 4 year IV meth habit... This opiate habit struck me like a cancer.
That phenomenon of craving is so fucking real, and there has never been any doubt that I'm a true-blue addict regarding these pills. I have nearly 6 months sober...

I finally was honest with myself about this fact, and have been trying so, so hard to get a truly good amount of time together. It was not until I was able to put together a year, which turned into a year and a half (where I am currently), and now I am truly beginning to realize that there is a major difference in my thought process overall.

I remember when I was using... Well consider this: there is no better time than now, because it always is ‘now’. If you put it off until tomorrow, it will still be ‘now’, just tomorrow! And today will be gone.
I was in recovery, and actually a year or so into it at that point. ... Never once did I think that I would ever think about dope (and it’s companions) without romanticizing. But I was wrong.
Clean for over two years... (past tense) ...Why am I still searching this shit. (present tense, but in the context of past recovery and current withdrawal)
I've been clean for two years, and my drug of choice is and always will be heroin. I haven't tried to get any dope, or even any painkillers.
The worst thing about a craving is that when I get one, it's not for a fuckin vicodin or two, but a needle and a bundle of downs. Ugh. Clenching my teeth lately.
These movies all make me want to get high.
I haven't shot dope in two years... .
I haven't touched an opiate in over two years, haven't shot up in almost three...
So I am about 90-100 days clean. It’s the most clean time I’ve had and I seriously couldn’t be happier.
I’m over 1 year into sobriety... Today was a little brutal I was almost shivering and it was like 55 degrees...
I've been sober for 13 months this coming Friday... When I got clean, I didn't think my last shot of heroin would be the last one for the rest of my life.
The 17th was the last time I had a shot of heroin.
Today i am 15 days off heroin.
Today i am at day 20 heroin and alcohol free.
Today is the start of day 21, indicating a past tense reference to opiate use cessation. The state label 'withdrawal' also supports this classification.
Today is 34 days without heroin and alcohol, Day 34 Heroin free
Im day 39 heroin and alcohol free.
Today i am on day 50 heroin and alcohol free. I have never made it this far before with heroin and alcohol.
Im on day two without heroin. I been in the bathroom all day puking and shitting.
I am day 10 off heroin... been in hospital (was brought in there the other day) for dehydration and withdrawals.
I am on day 15 off heroin.
I have been in rehab for the passed 3 months. I am two days out and i am living in a house with other clean and sober ppl.
I used every day for about a month. I was stealing and pawning my mom's jewelry to get money for dope.
With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals.
I go to 8 meetings a week, and have 62 days.
I got this cause to me it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person.
My life is filled with so much love instead of the bullshit it was filled with for so long.
I have four months clean today. These four months have been the hardest I've ever worked in my entire life.

I just wanted to tell you guys that this is my first sober Halloween in 5 years! (past tense), My mom even helped me put my zombie makeup on and Im taking my twelve year old sister trick or treating later. This is probably my favorite day of the year and hopefully I'll scare the shit out of some people.
This was the last time I hope I would ever use heroin.
Before my relapse 1 and 1/2 years ago, I had almost three years clean
Have almost 15 days clean now and I notice recovery has been getting harder and harder for me the more i relapse.
So today I have 252 days clean (8 months 8 days). My alternative sentence is 7 years w/ an 85% in state prison. So its safe to say I take my recovery very seriously.
I'm currently finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs.

Prior to this I was doing a gram of heroin every two days, so the oxy was actually a step down from what I was doing. One month and 8 grams of OxyContin later here I am with no opiates and no way to get them.
I quit dope about a month ago

I was heavily addicted to heroin last year but have been clean since June 14. I took some tramadol on friday, more on Saturday, skipped Sunday, used Monday, skipped yesterday, and yesterday I was feeling extremely depressed, sweating, cold, jittery/RLS, classic mild WDs.
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.
It's been nearly two years since I stopped injecting oxy, oxymorphone, hydromorphone, morphine, and anything else really.
Disclaimer I do not abuse this my health insurance fucked me and can no longer see my psychiatrist so I took matters in my own hands.
As of October 12th I was officially two years sober
This is what I did before I sold my studio for opiates 3 years ago.
I use kratom to treat members of the group with better success than I've seen in most other programs. I've gotten to know the plant inside and out over the past year
Tomorrow marks 1 week since my last 2lb dose of PST. ... I'm like 30 hours without sleep, and the 2 previous nights consisted of about 3-4 each.
I quit a daily PST habit of 2 1/2 pounds a day for about 2 years.
I'm currently 15 days clean off PST and wanted to post an update. ... used Lope taper to quit.
So I've got about 3 weeks clean off a 2 year PST habit of about 2 lbs a day.
5 weeks off a pretty heavy PST habit
12 year off and on opiate user with ~3 years as longest clean time, coming of my longest everyday using time of 2+ years (starting 300g poppy seeds/day, going to 2.5lbs seeds/day)
I've got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years.
End of day seven, goddamn bastard 14-hour workday is done. Bye-bye Egghead U, I'm going the hell home to a bath (my back!) and some sleep. Hold on guys, we can kick this shit! One. Week. CLEAN!
It's the kind of day I used to deal with by taking a handful of pills, so things wouldn't bug me so much.
When I kicked opiates I also kicked caffeine, and I haven't had a drink in a long time. And I promise myself that after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again.
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine.
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
Four weeks. I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin.
Six weeks was miles in the future, never thought I'd get here. Here I am. ... Six weeks clean, feels like kind of a big deal!
I have been out with family and friends, walked in nature, went to a concert, held hands with my love, played with my kid, did my taxes, did some exercises. I am still weak, it's a long road back.
I have been clean for ten weeks and three days -- I genuinely lost track.

Still clean as a whistle. I went to the pharmacy today and they had just gotten a shipment of painkillers... interesting test, talking to someone about my script while a large quantity of opiates was six inches from me. I actually asked them to move the bottles.

The video title 'Everything We Think We Know About Addiction Is Wrong' suggests a focus on past or current understanding of addiction, but the state label is 'recovery', indicating that the user has finished detoxing and is attempting to sustain abstinence from opiates long term. However, upon reviewing the content, there are no explicit mentions of opiate use in the present tense, only discussions about misconceptions surrounding addiction.
I have two years sober today... Sobriety is fucking crazy. 2 years feels like 10... and it keeps getting better.
We never used together but we were both hopeless dope fiends at the same time but never talked.

I was addicted to heroin again after my first stint in rehab got me almost 6 months of sobriety. ... I think the most important thing is honesty but a close second for me was habit/process. I had a habit of getting high every day and it was my routine... it took a process to create a new one.
I am 8 months sober from a heavy heroin habit. ... I know it is not their fault but I have been making great strides since those dark days.
I have been clean for 12 days other than 4 days ago I got a bag. Knowing as soon as I get some money I am going to be tempted to pick up again.
I haven't used since the day but the cravings have been there 24/7.
I haven't touched an opiate in almost 5 months.
I haven't used in around 3 weeks and it only appeared around the time the h would have been leaving my system so I'm not sure if there's any correlation.
My friend od’d on methadone last summer, ... (all language referring to opiate use is in the past tense)
I kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago and haven’t had the urge to use more than every now and then since

Pretty insecure about it cause I only really make joke music. Being serious scares the christ outta me... Anyways lmk what you think, any constructive criticism is accepted with open arms. Pretty new to this music thing.
it's about my mindset when I was using
I remember myself before using and I was fun, outgoing, worked my ass off and people enjoyed being around me. Now I have messed with drugs my entire adult life...
Still NO SLEEP!!!! (past tense of 'sleep', indicating past use) and Still NO SLEEP!!!! is accompanied by a combination of physical symptoms, which aligns with the state label 'withdrawal'.
I know I need to active but I just don't have the energy to get started and when I do I fatigue so quickly. But it does feel good to not have opiates pumping through me.
Feeling sooo much better. Sleep is still shit. But hit a meeting last night, great topics. Feeling good today, hopeful. Conversations are easier, crawling my ass out of bed is easier.
Didn't get to spend much time with her, but the joy I saw on her face when I wished her a happy birthday before anything else and her knowing it was sincere and that I am sober...
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.

Two years went by and I was making close to 1500$ a week living at home with my parents, paying close to no bills.....with a bank account running on E. Oxycontin was no longer my friend, but my lifeblood. I needed it more than food in the morning.

Tried to cold turkey approx 8mg sub last year went a month clean and I just couldn't bear it anymore. Took the subs for 7 days, still felt a bit strange during that time. Probably the kratom withdrawal under the subs.
Now I am one of those people, and you the reader with a bit of grit and hard work will be too.
it's been about 4 months off opiates
I ran out of my meds soon after I got out and am continuing to heal up, find a job and change my life around. It's been 4 days since I did any opiates and hope I can continue to stay sober.
I figured it was time to stop. Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

Starting all over now. Day 3. My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals...
I just got out of my 2nd stint in rehab today and my mother is sooo supportive. I am now 23 and feel like I need to get it right this time; I know I do not want to pick up.
I have meditated on and off, usually when I had a steady supply of heroin. Was doing a bundle a day but now im 24 days clean...
So I have been clean now from heroin, well from everything including cigarettes for 40 days. ... Working out and meditating has saved me from wanting to ever use again
I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days.
I remember endless aching Timeless nights spent sleepless, taking anything to stop the shaking,
I was thinking yesterday listening to this podcast about a life story from a former addict who actually turned their life around and now has a masters degree, a family, etc, and is doing great.

stick the needle in my arm, constant hell, im left alone, burned my bridges, now i'm home, in the dark, dwell my soul, i am lifeless, i am cold, i was but a dying rose, spoiled, rotton, and decomposed
A few months later, I landed my dream job working on robotics in a biotech company. It was the one thing I had wanted in my life and I got it.
This withdrawal thing didn’t work so good in the past,

So I went home to my parents and told them everything and tomorrow I am off to rehab. (past tense) The state label is 'None' is not applicable here, as the post discusses the user's decision to seek help for opiate addiction, which aligns with the definition of 'recovery'.
I survived day 1 (today) easy, I have no idea why I tried to do it myself 50 times when I should have come here right away. They make the W 80% better...

Two months off heroin. (This indicates that the user has ceased or lowered their opiate intake, meeting the condition for label '1'). I still have running lava from my ass and only sleep five hours a night (These phrases indicate ongoing physical symptoms of withdrawal). However I feel like my personality is back... (The use of past tense in this phrase suggests that the user's recovery has been successful).
I am clean now. Five days ago I did two shots of heroin... Did not enjoy the high for more that 20 min, could not stat awake, not worth it.
I made a post about taking a small shot in the middle of my wd, and I am soo glad I did cuz yea I had to start the wd all over but it is like 1/3 painfull so I am actually enjoying myself.
Being clean is hard but if I keep it up mabye some day I won’t have to keep fighting the urge to use or to kill myself.
On day 7!!!!!, in the next 12 hours or so I will oficially have a week clean. The only WD symtoms I am still having is the sleep...
This is not my first rodeo with recovery though, but my first time getting clean without rehab( just got kicked off my moms insurance).
Just hit day 8 of quitting so I have been officially clean for a week now.
I'm finally over the physical withdraws, which is great.
I'm close to the end of day 12 of being sober and I am extremely stressed about going to work.
Today is day 1 after coming off a two week run. Any idea on what to expect for withdrawal from only a 2 week run?

I did a three day sub taper which helped out but seemed to prolong the WD process. And working through this and trying to function as a normal human being has been the hardest thing I ever done especially when my sub taper was over.
I’m closing in on about two weeks clean... A few co workers of mine even mentioned how burned out I’ve been looking lately and if everything is ok.
I’ve been clean for 2 weeks and relapsed last night by snorting two stamp bags of heroin (ecp). I’ve been done the physical withdraws for like a week now,

My dealer always told me if I ever wanted to quit he would completely cut me off and I finally gave him the word and he completely cut me off lol. Something I could never do even in my other quit attempts so I guess I’m all in this time.
Once you got clean, how long did it take to feel like your was brain was pumping out them juices again?
I’m clean now with 25 days sober
Anyone on here right now that is sober or looking to get sober

I’m newly clean (got 10 days completely sober), because I used in my car so much I’m still a little worried I could of missed something that got stuck in some crevice or got in somewhere I couldn’t get to. I’d be damned if I got popped for something when I don’t even do drugs anymore.
Im 90 days sober. My main question here for my people in recovery is what significant or little changes have you noticed in yourself?
Until one day I just had to leave because I was dope sick... Now that I'm sober
Luckily I've only been using everyday for about 3 weeks, but fuck. I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough.
Started Suboxone today and doing IOP.
This is my first sober weekend so I'm staying busy. ... This is my first time taking the total abstinence path, so I felt isolated but met some really cool guys at the meeting and got some numbers.
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.
I haven't been sick in years, at least I haven't felt sick, other than withdrawals, in years.
I'm 4 weeks sober, 28 days yeah yeah! I'm clean another day and thankful for that!
Earlier this summer if you told me that at midnight every Friday and Saturday night I'd be at an NA meeting, I would have laughed in your face.
But, I am clean, and life is good! ... We all can, and will, get our lives back in time.

I've hemmed and hauled about weather or not to go, but after getting advice from my IOP group, NA home group, and therapists; I have decided to go. All my friends know I am in recovery and will not be drinking with them.
It's day 59 for me. Yesterday I had a big surprise; I graduated from IOP! ... So now I have my certificate, and I, feeling pretty good! My continuing care group is awesome!
Still do key tags at my Friday night homegroup, and I just started with HNI. Will be bringing meetings into a local detox facility the second Tuesday of every month.

It's day 110 for me since I last used opiates... I've gotten out of little 90 day funk finally! Just been doing lots of meetings, therapy, step work, and hanging out with new as well as old friends. It snowed today for the first time that I've ever been sober.

I finally asked for help, and started being honest. Honest with my family, with my friends, with my therapist, and most importantly with myself. It was the first time that I truly accepted that I was indeed an addict, and that I couldn't do it by myself.
Now after quitting H for almost 2 years it's like I've aged 10 years.
I had my last oxy yesterday morning -- then I had about 1mg of sub last night, and I'm 100% dry
I was using 60mg of oxy to get right daily and 30mg to not be sick. Come at me, chills; come at me stomach problems. I'm so tired of constantly dealing with moderate to severe withdrawals.
After 90 hours since my last oxycodone dose, I can officially say that I am withdrawal free (with minor exception).
I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.
Smoked a roach I had in my ash tray on Friday night and felt immense relief from the nasty cravings I was/am getting for my DOC.
Went back for that one last time. This time was rough. Slept the first 12 hours. Unable to keep any food or even water down.
I just hit 96 hours into my current detox. Wasn't completely open but was open about how much I was struggling.
I'm barely 100 hours into my detox... three hours after my last dose...

I've been to rehab before, last stint was in 2009. It was a very clinical style rehab, I learnt a lot about my addiction intellectually and it all made sense to me. I stayed clean for a year and a half and the roller coaster began again.
I think that's normal for normies, but as an addict in early recovery (Feb. 22), I'm tripping balls.

I have been clean off heroin for 7 years and some change. ... After trying NA and all that and never making 60 days of being clean, I was in the suboxin program multiple times. I had finally made it, I thought, had a job, a car, was selling OxyContin in 09 and taking subs, had money,women, dope was never sick and after spending 5 hours trying to find a vein one day I just had enough and stopped.
Now before everyone freaks out just know I'm a ex homeless junkie who managed to kick a 8 ball a day habit on 9 suboxin. Detox 7 times, impatient numerous times...etc etc.
I relapsed and it turned into a three month bender... I was previously an active user for 8 years with 6 months clean once or twice until this last 90 day slip.
Headed into day 4 now of withdrawal from bth. Far from my first rodeo but I'm at the breaking point.
Haven't slept still at all, just absolutely miserable and losing my mind. ...my hellish withdrawals went from %99 to about %30 now.
I was basically sitting on my hands watching the clock minute by minute telling myself not to leave the house. I knew if I left I'd get dope.
used to share my opiate inspired artwork here now and then, Just celebrated 18 months clean
I have a little over 18 months clean... who knew I'd get clean and feel the same.

I have been opiate free for a respectable amount of time... I wasn't ever a huge gamer, but twice a week I would be able to sit in front of an Xbox or computer for a couple hours and indulge in fantasy world. But now, the thought of playing sounds absolutely boring.
He kicked with over 120 oxy 30s and over $200 of heroin IN HIS POSSESSION.

My close friend and I both went through a long history together abusing opiates. He was more of the pills and I was more of the H. However, on our journey in recovery (were both about 1.5 years sober), we've noticed that we both have extremely bad reactions to specific foods.
So here I am, 60 days clean today.
Just out of curiosity. I feel like getting to a meeting and expanding my support group a little.

These 6 months of recovery have been fucking amazing!! I started at the very bottom at a sales job, and have worked my way close to the top. Just got promoted to sales manager last week! I'm making great money, and will be in the market for my own little condo by summer.
I've been in and out of recovery since '09 and this is the longest I've managed to stay clean.

I've been sticking it out, and great things are happening in my life right now. I'm starting to reap the rewards of all the hard work I've put in, and it's just fucking exhilarating. Better than any high heroin ever offered.
coming off a 3 week heroin binge... expecting to be ready to die in about eight hours
then i learned it was sunday. saw a bunch of my old foils, burned all the residue off, enough for 2-3 good rips, didnt smoke ANY.
my W/D's finished and i'm alive!
havent used one of these in about a year.

I got one to help cope with withdrawal and chip off Heroin, because for some reason I don't feel a craving for Oxy like I do with Heroin and as long as I do a tiny bit of opiate I can usually endure any remaining w/d symptoms.
I'm on another clean streak, still in acute withdrawal... somehow I always end up back here.
I was taking 8mg clonazepam for 2 full years daily (RX'd) and probably 80-100mg oxycodone a day and cut both cold turkey once.

I haven't had a dream about using in almost a month, ... My doctor even says that I was stabilized far too high at detox (which is rare from what I hear) and I'm on a taper plan where I drop 2mg per week down to 8 (currently on 10, dropping to 8 tomorrow),

i stopped taking it for a day and a half because i hurt my knee at work, and over the weekend i've probably taken about 80mg-120mg of oxycodone... if i took my last perc 10 at 1am tonight, if i woke up at 10-11am the next day
I've mostly had a connect for just percs/oxyneo for the last while and haven't really dabbled in the dope scene since february
He used to sell A LOT of weed but he's straight now.
im 9 months clean... but damn, i could be having the best day ever and sometimes i just miss partying and getting high.
Maybe its the withdrawl, maybe I'm just crazy, maybe I don't have what it takes to overcome my issues.

I was physically addicted and was basically using to not be sick so I could function, go to work, etc, you know how it goes. ... I was in hardcore, white knuckle, cold turkey withdrawal(puking, shitting, cold sweats, can't get comfortable, etc).
Using was fun. This is my weakness.
I've come to terms with my past, I no longer have that shame that comes with realizing that I am indeed an Addict, with a capital A. Using was my coping skill for life's shit.

the PAWS is so much to handle, Heavy depression, irratability, anxiety, and the most intense cravings i've ever had. (past tense of experiencing cravings), I keep obssessing about drugs (past tense of obsessing) and just want to sleep all day.
I flushed them down the toilet last night because I caught myself taking more than prescribed to reach a recreational dose
I've been off opiates for 26 days now...my gp gave me gabapentin to help withdrawl three weeks ago and last night i flushed then down the toilet because I caught myself abusing them.
I had 31 days yesterday and threw it all away when a coworker offered me free vicodin. He had a bottle with him he didnt want and offered them to me and I popped 4 of them without hesitation.
Was using opiates on and off for about 3 years, alternating between norco, some tramadol, and lastly codeien.
I'm happy to get coffee, talk recovery, etc.
55 days sober today and man, it is still tough! The last few nights I've woken up gasping for air in a total panic for no reason at all.
Since getting clean, I've had extreme anxiety and frequent headaches.
I’m almost 7 months clean and I’m just having the hardest time... I was only using short acting pain pills, no heroin or methadone, albeit I was using norco/codeien for about 4 years prior.
I’m a few days past 7 months of complete sobriety. I suffered for years quitting and relapsing, and im finally feeling like myself again.
So when I get sober, when do I know what's withdrawal pain and what is my disease pain as I forgot how it is to be sober.
I started withdrawing 18 hours out. I'm talking puking and everything so I just went back to what I knew fixed it.
I finally got off of dope using a sub taper. Coming up on 6 months clean from heroin/fent.
I actually went off on a guest over the weekend. So much so, that I am kind of afraid for my job.
I have to say, I have been *much* sicker with the flu, than I ever was with opiate withdrawal.
I remember being happy every single day. Happy all the time.
I have been off opiates for 3 years now thanks to kratom & a shit-load of willpower.
I decided to quit about a month ago and for the first time, I felt like I was mentally done with the shit.
I loved every single second of every high, but I just love life more than drugs now. ... When I was using...
Over the past month, I couldn't take a damn nap to save my life.
I have 135 days today... I quit cold turkey and I don't go to NA/AA. This is my first time quitting in my 8 years of using and I haven't relapsed so far.

I just looked back on a post I made on r/opiates when I was just about to quit fentanyl...that I tried, that I made it farther than I ever believed I could, and that I DID end up getting my life back.
It makes me feel so fortunate to be clean and have a warm bed in a nice apartment with a full stomach.
I have 16 months clean as of Monday, and I'm going in for oral surgery tomorrow because the worst of my many bad teeth has been keeping me awake for days.
I used to get off to this subreddit but it just makes me nervous.
With that said I just found out one of my closest friends might have a problem with opiates... If you're not happy with what you find then maybe consider a change.
I was on opiates for about 2 years after my accident, and stupidly decided to quit cold turkey instead of taper off.
This is the last time I will go through this.
Finally deleted dealers' numbers. Man they really tried to talk me out of it! That was hard but I feel a lot better.
I'm a little over a week clean now and I've had withdrawal, but what about *second* withdrawal!? (I didn't relapse, just seemed to go away after a few days and come back wtf)
I'm finally over the worst of WD (withdrawal) and my life is so much better.
I've been clean for a few months.
I am happy it happened (past tense of 'happened' indicates past opiate use), and the state label is 'withdrawal'.
I went to rehab and just got out last Tuesday.
I've been clean over a month now but when I went to rehab everyone there told me that they could get high in their dreams and that it was weird that I couldn't.
I've continued to stay clean, I've bought a car and i've dealt with the financial ruin that I have caused. I'm pretty proud of myself.
I was clean from heroin a year on May 22nd. ... My last birthday in my 20's and 20 days shy of one year clean of heroin.
I have the strongest fucking urge to use today for some reason and it's pouring down rain and I'm in my car and I'm just super down today but I guess I can't throw it away.
A few months back, I started a blog with a group of friends. We write about a bunch of stuff, and we have some legitimate fun centered around a lifestyle free of drugs and alcohol.
One of our writers, Johnny, just got a whole year clean
Meditation is a tool that my friends and I have found to be super helpful in staying clean.
We believe that Star Wars is actually super deep, and wrote up this piece on how the Last Jedi relates to being clean and sober.
A lot of us who get clean and sober have this common experience of finding out who we really are as people.
having 7 months, 7 months clean and sober
My friend Chad used to do a lot of wild stuff in his addiction, but he's been clean for about a year now and wrote about how he's overcome his fears while in recovery.
When I was actively using, ... My friend Kimberly is dual diagnosed and has been clean/sober for almost a year.
They're both young and have multiple years clean and sober.
Check out this article by my friend Aly about what her journey has been like for the past 4 years!
My friend Cassidy wrote this article sharing her experience, maybe someone here can relate!
I've been clean and sober for over 4 years.
five and a half months ain't goin' out like that.
shot dope for the last time January 19th of last year if I am not mistaken.
I went through the 12 steps of AA in my first three months, and have continued to live more or less along those lines.

I have been sober from IV heroin and everything else. I have traveled to five continents this past year. ... The obsession left and has never returned, at least not anything close to what I used to feel: the clammy hands, writhing stomach, and murderous determination to get a fix.
I quit it, ain't fuckin with it...say that all the time
He was still pale and sweating but now crying from the pain of precipitated w/d.

post_id: day 4 clean. ... My anxiety is getting really out of hand. I'm shaking; my body feels like I'm dying.

verbatim_example: I'm on day 3 of being clean after a couple of slip ups since deciding to get clean.

I've been trying to take another look at my life and my recovery and really see what needs to be done and what needs to change to be successful this time around. I'm realizing that I have some things in my life that need to be dealt with.
I have 26 days clean. But god I never wake up without thinking about it.
Spent the past 3 days using. It's been about 9 hours since I came down from the last time.
I started feeling like I at least needed a break...so I switched to snorting for like a week or so before, and finally quit over the weekend.
I got clean one year and two months ago... I checked myself into rehab the next day and never looked back.
I've been perscribed suboxone since october of last year
Today I have 78 days. My longest clean time from heroin...ever!!!
Today I have a little over nine months clean from IV heroin.
I've been clean for almost a year from iv heroin and I remember how hard it was in the beginning and failing multiple times.
I am at solid landings rock solid recovery and am at day 5 of 90... So the only way would be to find a sober living that would pay half or some of the cost of the sober house.
i am going to get a therapist maybe that will help, cravings seem to have gotten stronger now at 6 months then they were at 3.
I am sober off illegal substances but take 70mg methadone and it makes me tired so i have to drink coffee daily.
